title: Maryland Stadium Authority to Offer $261.8 Million in Bonds for Oriole Park Upgrades
content:
Maryland Stadium Authority is selling approximately $261.8 million in bonds for capital improvements at the Oriole Park baseball stadium and related facilities in Baltimore.

The offering consists of approximately $251.4 million in Series 2025B Taxable Revenue Bonds with maturities ranging from 2027 through 2038. Series 2025C Taxable Revenue Bonds in the amount of approximately $10.4 million will also be offered. These securities mature in 2027, as per the preliminary official statement posted on MuniOS on Wednesday.

Pricing on the bonds is slated for Aug. 13, with closing scheduled for Aug. 27.

Interest on the bonds is payable on Dec. 15, 2025 and semi-annually thereafter.

The bonds are limited obligations of the Maryland Stadium Authority, payable solely from the Trust Estate, which primarily consists of money in the Camden Yards Baseball Sports Facility Supplemental Financing Fund. This fund receives proceeds from the State Lottery Fund.

Proceeds will be used to finance capital improvements to Oriole Park at Camden Yards and other sports facilities. The funds will cover design, renovation, development, and construction costs, as well as pay interest accruing through June 15, 2026, and cover issuance costs.

Upgrades to Oriole Park include a new center field videoboard, right field wall display, upper deck and club level LED ribbon boards, and a unified control room. The new center field videoboard will be two and a half times larger than the existing one, making it the 12th largest videoboard among Major League Baseball stadiums. The enhancements are scheduled to begin following the 2025 season and be operational for 2026, according to the Maryland Stadium Authority website.

S&P Global Ratings and Fitch Ratings have both issued AA ratings on the bonds.
summary: Maryland Stadium Authority is selling $261.8 million in bonds for capital improvements at the Oriole Park baseball stadium and related facilities in Baltimore. The offering includes approximately $251.4 million in Series 2025B Taxable Revenue Bonds with maturities ranging from 2027 through 2038. Additional Series 2025C Taxable Bonds will also be offered. Interest on the bonds is payable on Dec. 15, 2025, and semi-annually thereafter. The bonds are limited obligations from the Trust Estate, which primarily consists of money in the Camden Yards Baseball Sports Facility Supplemental Financing Fund. Proceeds will be used to finance capital improvements to Orioles Park at Camden Yards and other sports facilities. The upgrades include a new center field videoboard, right field wall display, upper deck and club level LED ribbon boards, and a unified control room.
shortSummary: The Maryland Stadium Authority is selling $261.8 million in bonds to fund capital improvements at Oriole Park, with maturity set at 2027.
argos_summary: The Maryland Stadium Authority is issuing approximately $261.8 million in bonds for capital improvements at Oriole Park in Baltimore, including $251.4 million in Series 2025B Taxable Revenue Bonds and $10.4 million in Series 2025C Taxable Revenue Bonds. The funds will finance renovations such as a new larger videoboard and various upgrades, with work expected to start after the 2025 season. The bonds, rated AA by S&P Global Ratings and Fitch Ratings, will be priced on August 13 and close on August 27.
